title: The Empress Meaning - Major Arcana Tarot Card Meanings

Upright Keywords
Reversed Keywords
divine feminine, sensuality, fertility, nurturing, creativity, beauty, abundance, nature
insecurity, overbearing, negligence, smothering, lack of growth, lack of progress

Comparing the The Empress across different tarot decks.

description: The Empress depicts a woman sitting on a throne. From the abundant nature that surrounds her, we can assume that this woman represents the Earth Mother archetype, a goddess of fertility. Her world is ruled by venus which means that there is complete love, harmony, fertility and luxury by the grace of this goddess. The woman herself has blonde hair crowned with stars, signaling her divine connection with the mystical realm. She is dressed in a pomegranate-patterned robe that represents fertility, and she is seated on cushions embroidered with a venus sign. She is surrounded by an enchanting green forest with a river streaming through it. The Empress brings abundance and blessings in the readings of those she meets.

upright.overview:
The Empress shows us how deeply we are embedded to our femininity. Femininity could be associated with fertility, expression, creativity and nurturing among many other aspects. It therefore calls you to connect with beauty and bring happiness to your life. Understand yourself and get in touch with your sensuality so that you can attract life circumstances to bring happiness and joy. She is a signal that be kind to yourself, to take care of yourself.

The Empress is associated with fertility, expression, creativity and nurturing among many other aspects.

The Empress is also a strong indication of pregnancy and motherhood. You can look for other cards to confirm if this is truly pregnancy, or rather just an indication of a motherly, nurturing and caring attitude. The Empress card could also mean the birth of a new idea, business or project on your life. Owing to the good fortune that surrounds this card, you can be sure that such situations and projects would end successfully in your life. Discover and bring forth those ideas that have been clinging to you and make sure that you devote yourself towards accomplishing them. This card is a sign that they are going to be successful, and well taken care of. The Empress, as the archetype of the mother earth, also encourages you to spend time interacting with nature, the mother of all of us.
upright.love_meaning:
The Empress tarot love meaning stems from the element of earth. The person represented by this card can be loving, nurturing and caring, as has financial security or appreciative of beautiful, comforting things. Sometimes, the Empress can point to love and work coming together, either with a coworker, or perhaps a new business venture.
When it comes to relationships, this card also heralds a stable, serious and committed relationship. Because the card also represents motherhood, sometimes it can also signal marriage or pregnancy, or at least a new family, in whatever form that means for you.
Career Meaning - Upright Empress
Your career right now may be enjoying a boost right now. You may be more creative and passionate than usual, and putting all your ideas to work in your projects. Since the Empress is related to nourishment and nurturing, it may also suggest that you’re feeling particularly nurturing and generous when it comes to your workplace as well. You may be working on making a more harmonious and welcoming office, whether that means being supportive of coworkers, or putting a new coat of paint at your home office. Having the environment to do your best can certainly give you even more momentum. Sometimes, this card can also point to another person in your workplace that has these qualities.
Finances Meaning - Upright Empress
The Empress is abundant both creatively and materially, so this card can point to a comfortable financial situation. You may also be feeling very generous with your money now, wanting to nourish your friends and family with your abundance and good luck. It is certainly a good time to share what you have.
upright.career_meaning: Your career right now may be enjoying a boost right now. You may be more creative and passionate than usual, and putting all your ideas to work in your projects. Since the Empress is related to nourishment and nurturing, it may also suggest that you’re feeling particularly nurturing and generous when it comes to your workplace as well. You may be working on making a more harmonious and welcoming office, whether that means being supportive of coworkers, or putting a new coat of paint at your home office. Having the environment to do your best can certainly give you even more momentum. Sometimes, this card can also point to another person in your workplace that has these qualities.
upright.finances_meaning: The Empress is abundant both creatively and materially, so this card can point to a comfortable financial situation. You may also be feeling very generous with your money now, wanting to nourish your friends and family with your abundance and good luck. It is certainly a good time to share what you have.
upright.as_feelings:
When you draw The Empress, someone is overflowing with warmth and affection for you. They see you as nurturing and abundant, drawn to your caring nature. You are a source of comfort and inspiration in their life, bringing beauty wherever you go. Their feelings are rooted in admiration and a desire for growth together, hinting at a future filled with love and harmony.
The arrival of The Empress signals a surge of creativity and emotional fulfillment in your life. You may feel more connected to your desires and instincts than ever before, fully embracing the joy that comes from self-love. This card urges you to nurture yourself while also recognizing the blossoming relationships around you.
upright.as_actions: Guided by The Empress, you are encouraged to embrace nurturing actions and creativity in your life. This card encourages you to cultivate a sense of abundance, both within yourself and in your surroundings. Focus on self-care by engaging in activities that bring you joy, such as gardening or cooking nourishing meals. Consider fostering relationships by reaching out to loved ones or creating a supportive community around you. Additionally, channel your creative energy into artistic projects or hobbies that inspire you. By embracing these nurturing actions, you'll not only enhance your well-being but also attract positivity and growth into your life.
upright.love: nurturing, supportive lover, sensual committed relationship
upright.career: nurturing colleagues, freshening up office, creative period at work
upright.finances: material comfort, giving, sharing material wealth, generosity

reversed.overview:
The Empress reversed indicates that you have lost too much of your own willpower and strength because you have started placing too much effort and concern to other people’s affairs. While the Empress's nature is of showering her loved ones with attention and care, this can sometimes go overboard. You might be neglecting your own needs, or even smothering the ones you love with your well-intentioned actions.
In a role reversal, perhaps a reversed Empress is finding her way into your life; it could also mean that you are relying on others to take care of you, and make decisions for you. You need to work towards removing this influence on your life, and build confidence in your own actions. Always try as much as you can to ensure that you solve matters on your own.
reversed.career_meaning: Your career may be feeling stale, tedious and unfulfilling right now. It may feel that you’re making little progress when it comes to developing your skills and abilities. The work is monotonous, and perhaps you’ve already mastered what you can do in this position. You may feel that others don’t appreciate the work you’re doing, further adding to your frustration. At times, this card also can point to a feeling of being insecure when it comes to your career. This may also be causing the other problems you’re experiencing. It’s important to take the time now and sort out which of these are problems that require an external change, like switching jobs, versus an internal one, like developing better confidence and communication skills.
reversed.finances_meaning: Since the Empress is generally a great card to have with finances, even in the reversed position, she still signals a comfortable amount of financial stability. However, in reverse, she may suggest that despite you having enough, you may still feel unstable. Sometimes, this can come from growing up in poverty, or is just the nature of being self-employed. You may have to do some internal work to understand why this is so; and what you can do to change it. Continue to be responsible with your finances, and it’s likely you’ll be fine.
reversed.as_feelings:
When you pull the reversed Empress in response to how someone feels about you, it suggests that this person may be experiencing feelings of insecurity or emotional distance. They might struggle with nurturing their connection with you, feeling overwhelmed by self-doubt or a lack of confidence in your relationship. Their affection could feel stifled, as if they are unable to express themselves fully due to fears of inadequacy.
In the realm of your own feelings, the reversed Empress indicates a sense of disconnection from your own emotions and desires. You may find yourself grappling with issues related to self-worth or creativity, leading to frustration and dissatisfaction within yourself. This card encourages you to explore what truly nurtures your spirit and seek ways to reconnect with your inner abundance and joy.
reversed.as_actions: In the presence of The Empress reversed, you’re encouraged to turn your attention inward and reassess what truly matters. This card indicates a need to reconnect with your inner self, so take time for self-care and reflection. Consider journaling about your feelings or engaging in creative activities that bring you joy. It may also be beneficial to evaluate the relationships in your life; are they supportive or draining? Set boundaries where necessary, allowing space for growth. By prioritizing your well-being and fostering a healthier environment around you, you'll cultivate the abundance and fulfillment that The Empress embodies when upright.
reversed.love: lack of self worth, jealous, clingy lover, lack of progress in love
reversed.career: feeling insecure at work, not growing skills, stale job
reversed.finances: feeling insecure about finances, despite being stable

abyss: The Empress is the Bringer of Life. She walks the Earth with grace, love, and care, cradling her ripe belly as she births the world around her. She is in perfect harmony with all her surroundings and her intentions are from the heart. She is Mother Nature at her core, the epitome of fruitfulness and bounty. She is summer in her prime, her hands blending and shaping the world around her, leaving a trail of blooming flowers and new life. In some instances, that creative energy can take the shape of artistic birth or even physical birth. Whereas the High Priestess represented the virginal aspect, the Empress represents the maternal aspect, physically active in her creation and a problem solver. She is the creator, the birther of creativity, of life itself. When she appears in your spread, she brings with her the active forces of progression, whether in love, business, creation, or literally pregnancy and physical birth. Be open to what this period will bring and utilize her gifts wisely. There is also a sense of hope that comes with this card, the idea that all the work that was put in at the beginning was not in vain. Since the Empress is shown at the end of her pregnancy, this too is an indication of an abundant outcome that will soon materialize. If you were to search for her in your own life, you'd most likely find her as a woman who is important to you, someone helpful and influential.
